Package net.viktorc.pp4j.impl

Class AbstractProcessManager

  • Object
    • AbstractProcessManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ProcessManager, Resettable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SimpleProcessManager
    public abstract class AbstractProcessManager
extends Object
implements ProcessManager
    An abstract implementation of the ProcessManager interface that allows for the definition of the process builder instance to use to launch the processes, the duration of continuous idleness after which processes are to be terminated, and the character set to use when exchanging messages with the processes through their standard streams. It also stores all the startup outputs of the processes.
    Author:
    Viktor Csomor

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractProcessManager

        protected AbstractProcessManager​(ProcessBuilder builder,
                                 Charset charset,
                                 Long keepAliveTime)
        Constructs a manager for the processes created by the specified ProcessBuilder with the specified maximum life span.
        Parameters:
        builder - The instance to build the processes with.
        charset - The character set to use to communicate with the managed process.
        keepAliveTime - The number of milliseconds after which idle processes are terminated. If it is null, the life span of the process will not be limited.

    • Method Detail

      • getStartupOutputStore

        public ProcessOutputStore getStartupOutputStore()
        Returns the process output store containing the process' startup output.
        Returns:
        The output store used to capture to process' pre-startup output.

      • isProcessStartedUp

        protected abstract boolean isProcessStartedUp​(String outputLine,
                                              boolean error)
                                       throws FailedStartupException
        It determines whether the line output by the process denotes that it has successfully started up.
        Parameters:
        outputLine - The line output by the process.
        error - Whether the line was output to the process' standard error stream or its standard out stream.
        Returns:
        Whether the output line denotes the startup of the process.
        Throws:
        FailedStartupException - If the output line denotes that the startup of the process has failed.

      • start

        public Process start()
              throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: ProcessManager
        Starts a new process. The process created should always be the same and it should always be started only upon the call of this method.
        Specified by:
        start in interface ProcessManager
        Returns:
        A new process.
        Throws:
        IOException - If the process cannot be started.

      • getEncoding

        public Charset getEncoding()
        Description copied from interface: ProcessManager
        Returns the character set to use to communicate with the managed process through its standard streams.
        Specified by:
        getEncoding in interface ProcessManager
        Returns:
        The character set to use when reading from and writing to the process' streams.

      • isStartedUp

        public boolean isStartedUp​(String outputLine,
                           boolean error)
                    throws FailedStartupException
        Description copied from interface: ProcessManager
        Handles the output of the process after its launch. The return value of the method determines whether the process is to be considered started up and ready for submissions. It is only ever called if ProcessManager.startsUpInstantly() returns false.
        Specified by:
        isStartedUp in interface ProcessManager
        Parameters:
        outputLine - A line of output produced by the process.
        error - Whether this line was output to the standard error or the standard out stream.
        Returns:
        Whether the process is to be considered started up.
        Throws:
        FailedStartupException - If the output signals a process failure and the process is not expected to recover.

      • getKeepAliveTime

        public Optional<Long> getKeepAliveTime()
        Description copied from interface: ProcessManager
        Determines the duration of continuous idleness after which the process is to be terminated. The process is considered idle if it is started up and not processing a submission.
        Specified by:
        getKeepAliveTime in interface ProcessManager
        Returns:
        The number of milliseconds of continuous idleness after which the process is to be terminated.

        Description copied from interface: Resettable

        Specified by:
